greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0; for n > 1, a(n) = A000265(A052331(n)).
comment: After n=1, differs from A240535 (which gives the same terms, but with mirrored binary expansion) for the first time at n=30, where a(30) = 11, while A240535(30) = 13. Note how 11 = "1011" and 13 = "1101" in binary.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
program: i = 0; for(n=1,oo,if(ispow2(isprimepower(n)), i++; v050376[i] = n); if(i == up_to,break));

A052331(n) = { my(s=0,e); while(n > 1, fordiv(n, d, if(((n/d)>1)&&ispow2(isprimepower(n/d)), e = vecsearch(v050376, n/d); if(!e, print("v050376 too short!"); return(1/0)); s += 2^(e-1); n = d; break))); (s); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 13 2018
